original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields up, rupee at 308.50/312.50 to US dollar at close
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka bonds were up at close, dealers said while the spot US dollar ended at 308.50/312.50 rupees.
Bond markets were quiet without active firm quotes in the morning shortly after opening. A Treasury bill auction is to be held on Tuesday.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 23.26/24.25 percent in mid-morning trade up from 23.15/30 Friday.
A bond maturing on 01.07.20225 was closed at 27.25/28.25 percent down from 27.20/40 percent Friday.
Three-months maturing bill closed at 22.75/23.25 percent, up from last close at 21.75/22.30 percent.
A six-month maturing bill closed at 19.00/20.00 percent unchanged from its last close.
The 12-month bill was closed at 17.50/19.30 percent. (Colombo/ June 26/2023)
